availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh Campbell (Saint Louis, Missouri, merchant, philanthropist, and commissioner)

body.p: Saint Louis, Missouri, merchant, philanthropist, and commissioner. Native of Ireland. Son of Robert Campbell and Virginia Kyle Campbell. Married to Mary Campbell. Merchant in Saint Louis, Missouri, in 1860. Employed Nicholas Seider as a waiter, and Kate Highland and Catherine Mahan as servants in St. Louis in 1860. Appointed to the Department of the West War Claims Commission in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis, St. Louis Ward 6, p. 435-36.
"Campbell Family," Campbell House Museum, http://www.campbellhousemuseum.org/history/campbell-family/ (accessed May 6, 2021).
"Missouri Republican, 1861-10-30," Newspapers.com, https://www.newspapers.com/image/666894692 (accessed May 6, 2021).
Missouri, U.S., Wills and Probate Records, 1766-1988, Missouri Probate Court (St. Louis City), vol. L-M, 1875-1879, p. 156-57.
Missouri Death Records, Missouri State Archives, Jefferson City, Missouri, City of St. Louis, 1878-1880, p. 40.
Find A Grave, "Hugh Campbell (1797-1879)," Memorial #121518283, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/121518283 (accessed May 6, 2021).
